context: Act 1 Chapter 1.1 — Won the Mechanic's Gamble against Preston Wells

lines.text: Silence. For one impossible moment, the entire Pit holds its breath.
Then the noise hits you like a wall. The CRX crosses the line and the crowd erupts — not in celebration, but in disbelief. The CRX beat the 911. The nobody beat Preston Wells.
You coast to a stop. Your hands won't unclench from the wheel. The engine ticks. Smoke curls from your front brakes. Every joint in your body aches.

lines.speaker: Pit Boss
lines.text: Well, I'll be damned.
The Pit Boss stands at the line, counting the spread on his stopwatch. He looks at you, looks at the CRX, and shakes his head like he's witnessing a miracle he doesn't believe in.

lines.speaker: Pit Boss
lines.text: Point-six seconds. In a CRX. Against a GT3.

lines.speaker: Pit Boss
lines.text: Somebody write that down. Nobody's gonna believe it.
The 911 rolls across the line. Slow. The engine sounds wrong — defeated. The door swings open and Preston Wells unfolds from the cockpit, face the color of raw meat.

lines.speaker: Preston Wells
lines.text: That's BULLSHIT!

lines.speaker: Preston Wells
lines.text: No way that heap beat me clean. No WAY. Check the car. Something's wrong with my car!
He kicks his own tire. The crowd watches, delighted. There's nothing the scene loves more than a rich man losing his composure.

lines.speaker: Maya
lines.text: Keys.
Maya steps forward. Her voice is flat. Her hand is out. She's not celebrating. She's collecting.

lines.speaker: Maya
lines.text: The title, the registration, and the keys. That was the deal, Preston. Unless your word is as cheap as your taste.

lines.speaker: Preston Wells
lines.text: This isn't over, Torres. Not by a long shot.

He slams the keys into her palm hard enough to leave a mark. Pulls the title from his glovebox. Shoves through the crowd toward a waiting black car — his driver, his escape hatch. Preston Wells always has an exit strategy.
Maya stands there, keys in hand, staring at the 911. Her 911, now.

lines.label: sabotage_aftermath
lines.text: But she's not smiling. She's quiet. Too quiet. The keys hang in her grip like they weigh a hundred pounds.

lines.speaker: Maya
lines.text: He was right.

lines.speaker: Maya
lines.text: Something was wrong with his car. Because we made it wrong.
She pockets the keys. Won't look at you.

lines.speaker: Maya
lines.text: Don't ever ask me to do that again. And don't ever let me offer.

lines.label: clean_aftermath
lines.text: Maya turns the keys over in her hand. Once. Twice. Then she looks at you and something breaks through — just for a second.
A smile. Small. Real. The kind she doesn't let people see.

lines.speaker: Maya
lines.text: That driving in the technical section — turns four through nine — you carried speed through apexes I didn't think the CRX could handle.
She catches herself. The smile vanishes. The walls go back up.

lines.speaker: Maya
lines.text: It was adequate.
Adequate. From Maya Torres, that's a standing ovation.

lines.label: scene_end
lines.text: The crowd disperses. The Pit empties. Under the floodlights, the CRX and the 911 sit side by side — the car that shouldn't have won, and the car that was never supposed to lose.
Tomorrow, the whole scene will be talking. The nobody in the CRX who took Preston Wells for his pink slip. Your name just became currency in Nova Pacifica.
